title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993". Conveyance vessels are addressed in the Act. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to convey, without consideration, two vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be at least 4,000 displacement tons, have no usefulness to the Government, and be scheduled for scrapping. Vessels eligible for conveyance must be in the National Defense Reserve Fleet, at least 4,000 displacement tons, have no usefulness to the Government, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations receiving the vessels must agree to sell them for scrap purposes. Before being conveyed, organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap purposes and use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship for merchant mariners. The organization must sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship for merchant mariners. Any leftover proceeds must be returned to the United States. The organization must sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship for merchant mariners. Any leftover proceeds must be returned to the United States and deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. The Secretary shall deliver each vessel conveyed at the location where it is located. The Secretary shall deliver each vessel conveyed under this section at its current location, in its current condition, and at no cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS.
